children.name: transitionEnd
children.description: Fires after the mobile view transition container has its `k-fx-end` class set. Setting CSS properties to the view at the event handler will animate them.

children.name: transitionStart
children.description: Fires when the mobile view transition starts.

children.name: show
children.description: Fires when the mobile View becomes visible.

children.name: init
children.description: Fires after the mobile View and its child widgets are initialized.

children.name: hide
children.description: Fires when the mobile View becomes hidden.

children.name: beforeShow
children.description: Fires before the mobile View becomes visible. The event can be prevented by calling the `preventDefault` method of the event parameter, in case a redirection should happen.

children.name: beforeHide
children.description: Fires before the mobile View becomes hidden.

children.name: afterShow
children.description: Fires after the mobile View becomes visible. If the view is displayed with transition, the event is triggered after the transition is complete.

children.name: enable

parameters.name: enable `Boolean`
parameters.description: Omitting the parameter or passing `true` enables the view. Passing `false` disables the view.

children.description: Enables or disables the user interaction with the view and its contents.

children.name: destroy
children.description: Prepares the **View** for safe removal from DOM. Detaches all event handlers and removes jQuery.data attributes to avoid memory leaks. Calls destroy method of any child Kendo widgets.> **Important:** This method does not remove the View element from DOM.

children.name: contentElement
children.description: Retrieves the current content holder of the View - this is the content element if the View is stretched or the scroll container otherwise.> **Important:** Use this method to get a reference container in order to remove or append contents to the View

children.name: zoom
children.description: If set to true, the user can zoom in/out the contents of the view using the pinch/zoom gesture.

children.name: useNativeScrolling
children.description: If set to true, the view will use the native scrolling available in the current platform. This should help with form issues on some platforms (namely Android and WP8).Native scrolling is only enabled on platforms that support it: iOS > 5+, Android > 3+, WP8. BlackBerry devices do support it, but the native scroller is flaky.

children.name: title
children.description: The text to display in the NavBar title (if present) and the browser title.

children.name: stretch
children.description: If set to true, the view will stretch its child contents to occupy the entire view, while disabling kinetic scrolling.Useful if the view contains an image or a map.

children.name: scroller
A view with elastic scrolling set to false

children.description: Configuration options to be passed to the scroller instance instantiated by the view. For more details, check the scroller [configuration options](/api/mobile/scroller#configuration).

children.name: reload
children.description: Applicable to remote views only. If set to true, the remote view contents will be reloaded from the server (using Ajax) each time the view is navigated to.

children.name: model
children.description: The MVVM model to bind to. If a string is passed, The view will try to resolve a reference to the view model variable in the global scope.
